instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: mbp 2011 17" not turning on
threads.message:
gets power and charges but no visible activity with power button
i'm assuming standard bad gpu, but i've been out of the game so long i can't remember if they would behave this way, my recollection is it would at least turn on right?
what rails should i check?

threads.title: mbp 2011 17" not turning on
threads.message:
First need to power on....

Green light??
Voltage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>?
Voltage on <SIGNAL>PP3V32_G3H</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: mbp 2011 17" not turning on
threads.message: Probably not using an ORIGINAL Apple 85W charger, must use 85W or it will not turn on if battery is empty.

threads.title: mbp 2011 17" not turning on
threads.message:
battery charges and is fully charged, green light
so ppbus-g3h is fine
doesn't turn on with charged battery

threads.title: mbp 2011 17" not turning on
threads.message:
Green light does not prove the battery is charged, battery indicator showing full charge?
Was the GPU messed with? Check for shorts, especially GPU rails.

threads.title: mbp 2011 17" not turning on
threads.message: yes bil shows fuels and charging when i try another battery. i don't think anyone messed with gpu, though maybe it was replaced by apple under the program

threads.title: mbp 2011 17" not turning on
threads.message: First check what date code is on the GPU. If this is still a 2011 one then you can put time and effort into this thing and it will have a dead GPU in 3 months.
